result.execSummary:
The defendant Radames J. Alvarado was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Radames J. Alvarado is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Radames J. Alvarado was found guilty of Intimidate Victim/Use or Attempt Force, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.45(1).
  • Radames J. Alvarado was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
from Defendant

*Judge reviewed letter/request.  No action taken*
of Sentencing Hearing

Defendant Radames J. Alvarado in court with attorney Jeremiah Wolfgang Meyer-O'Day.  Defendant Radames J. Alvarado in custody.  Matthew C. Allen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant will plea to Cts 1 & 2.  Ct 3 to be dismissed.  Defendant offers NC pleas.  Defendant sworn.  PLQ - colloquy given and knowing waiver accepted.   Joint recommendation:  Ct 1:  14 months initial confinement WSP w/ 36 months extended supervision, concurrent to any current sentences serving - continued mental health treatment and compliance with any additional treatment deemed necessary/appropriate by the DOC; no contact with victim, Whitney Reimann, or her residence.  Ct 2:  8 months jail, concurrent with Ct 1 and any other sentence serving.
Tammy Foye makes statement to the Court on behalf of the victim.
